page.title: 01GAZETTEER 1
page.content:
Our survey area covers the southern part of Bracknell,Berkshire and extend s south to the borders of Crowthorne. To the north are the neighbourhoods of Great Hollands,Hanworth,Birch Hill and Easthampstead while the south is mainly woodland.
Easthampstead is called'Lachenstede'in the original Domesday Survey when the area was part of the Royal Forest of Windsor.The name meant'the homestead by the gate'.Bracknell remained part of the Royal Forests for hundreds of years.In the C19th it was referred to as'a small village situated on the main road to the West of England'.
Change came in 1949 when Bracknell was designated a'New Town'and rapid modern expansion followed.Although new,the
